column1: '''Haranyë''' is a calendar term used in the context of the [[King's Reckoning]]. It is probably the name of the last year of a century.<ref name=D2>{{App

column2: In every fourth year, except the last of a century (''haranyë'')...

column1: The word is obviously [[Quenya]], but of uncertain etymology.
[[Helge Fauskanger]] notes that Tolkien's wording does not make clear whether the word describes the "last [year] of a century" or a translation of "century" itself.<ref>{{webcite
